guide.introduction: this color organ works by amplifying an audio input, then runing it through three frequency filters (high pass, band pass, and lowpass) then outputting to a darlington transistor to power leds in time with the music.
guide.introduction_rendered: this color organ works by amplifying an audio input, then runing it through three frequency filters (high pass, band pass, and lowpass) then outputting to a darlington transistor to power leds in time with the music.

lines.text: 7-9 npn type amplifying transistors.  (2n3904, 2n4401, or similar)
lines.text_raw: 7-9 npn type amplifying transistors.  (2n3904, 2n4401, or similar)

lines.text: 2 560 pf capacitors (2) 0.1 uf capacitors  (1) 220 pf capacitor  (1) 10 pf capacitor
lines.text_raw: 2 560 pf capacitors (2) 0.1 uf capacitors  (1) 220 pf capacitor  (1) 10 pf capacitor

lines.text: first use the lm386 as an amp, just connect audio ground to the op amp ground, positive to positive, and so on.  the output is then split three ways and run through three filters.
lines.text_raw: first use the lm386 as an amp, just connect audio ground to the op amp ground, positive to positive, and so on.  the output is then split three ways and run through three filters.

lines.text: the filter use a capacitor and resistor to allow some frequencies, but block others.  the 560 pf capacitors go with the 56k ohm resistors.  the 0.1 uf capacitors go with the 16k resistors.
lines.text_raw: the filter use a capacitor and resistor to allow some frequencies, but block others.  the 560 pf capacitors go with the 56k ohm resistors.  the 0.1 uf capacitors go with the 16k resistors.

lines.text: hook up one of each capacitor and resistor to the audio input and audio ground.  put one 0.1 uf from audio, and one from ground, add a 16k resistor to the opposite for each, and output that.
lines.text_raw: hook up one of each capacitor and resistor to the audio input and audio ground.  put one 0.1 uf from audio, and one from ground, add a 16k resistor to the opposite for each, and output that.

lines.text: now do the same for the 560pf caps, but use the input from the 0.1uf cap for the one which puts the capacitor
